meanings.definition: Thickening of the outer layer of the skin.
meanings.sent1: Hyperkeratosis can make the skin feel rough and bumpy.
meanings.sent2: The doctor diagnosed the patient with hyperkeratosis after examining the skin.
meanings.sent3: When hyperkeratosis strikes, it's like the skin is wearing a thick coat.
meanings.sent4: Her hyperkeratosis was a shield, protecting her skin from harm.
meanings.sent5: The hyperkeratosis on his feet was as hard as a rock.

meanings.definition: Excessive growth of keratin in the skin.
meanings.sent1: The hyperkeratosis caused the skin to become hardened and calloused.
meanings.sent2: People with hyperkeratosis may experience discomfort due to the thickened skin.
meanings.sent3: His hyperkeratosis was like a stubborn weed, growing uncontrollably.
meanings.sent4: The hyperkeratosis spread like wildfire, covering his entire body.
meanings.sent5: She tried to scrub away the hyperkeratosis, but it clung stubbornly to her skin.

meanings.definition: Condition characterized by the accumulation of keratin on the skin's surface.
meanings.sent1: Hyperkeratosis can result in the formation of rough, scaly patches on the skin.
meanings.sent2: The dermatologist recommended a treatment plan to manage the hyperkeratosis.
meanings.sent3: The hyperkeratosis on his elbows made them look like tree bark.
meanings.sent4: Her hyperkeratosis was like a layer of armor, protecting her delicate skin.
meanings.sent5: The hyperkeratosis on his hands felt like sandpaper to the touch.
